Key Arguments: The legislation is viewed as an attack on free speech and likened to totalitarian control.
The bill is seen as hypocritical, exempting government and professional news content from being labeled as misinformation.
The penalties for non-compliance are considered excessive and coercive.
The bill is perceived as outsourcing censorship to digital platforms, which could lead to self-censorship among individuals.
The author believes existing laws are sufficient to handle misinformation without the need for this new legislation.
Notable Quotes: This Draft Bill is the most despicable attack on free speech to ever occur in this country.
The ultimate aim of this Draft Bill, and that is to break the will of the people into the most effective form of censorship, that of self-censorship.
Bad information is combatted by better information, not by censorship.
